title: Texas Lawyers Group Expands Personal Injury Practice to Serve All Major Cities and Communities Across Texas

content:
Texas Lawyers Group, a leading legal services provider in the Lone Star State, proudly announces the expansion of its personal injury practice to cover all types of personal injury cases across every major city and community in Texas. This strategic growth ensures that individuals and families throughout the state have access to experienced, compassionate, and dedicated legal representation when facing the challenges of personal injury claims.

Texas Lawyers Group has long been recognized for its commitment to delivering justice for clients. With this expansion, the firm strengthens its mission to provide accessible, high-quality legal services to Texans in need, no matter where they reside. From Houston to Dallas, San Antonio to El Paso, and every community in between, Texas Lawyers Group is now positioned to handle a wide range of personal injury cases, including motor vehicle accidents, workplace injuries, slip-and-fall incidents, and wrongful death claims.

“This expansion is a testament to our unwavering commitment to the people of Texas,” said Jeff Howell, Esq., Managing Partner at Texas Lawyers Group. “We’ve seen the growing need for skilled legal representation in personal injury cases, and we’re proud to bring our expertise to every corner of the state, ensuring no one is left without a voice in their pursuit of justice.”

The decision to expand the personal injury practice comes in response to the increasing demand for skilled legal representation in personal injury matters across Texas. According to recent data from the Texas Department of Transportation, the state reported over 250,000 motor vehicle crashes in 2024 alone, resulting in thousands of injuries and fatalities. Workplace injuries and other incidents also continue to affect countless individuals, underscoring the need for reliable legal advocacy.

Texas Lawyers Group’s expanded practice aims to address these challenges by offering comprehensive legal support tailored to the unique needs of each client. The firm’s attorneys bring decades of combined experience in personal injury law, ensuring that clients receive knowledgeable guidance and vigorous representation. Whether negotiating with insurance companies or litigating in court, Texas Lawyers Group is committed to securing fair compensation for medical expenses, lost wages, pain and suffering, and other damages.

With offices and affiliated attorneys now serving every major city in Texas, including Austin, Houston, Dallas, San Antonio, Fort Worth, El Paso, and beyond, Texas Lawyers Group combines statewide reach with a deep understanding of local communities. The firm recognizes that each city and region in Texas has its own unique characteristics, from the bustling urban centers of Dallas and Houston to the rural communities of West Texas. This expansion ensures that clients in every corner of the state can access legal services that are both highly professional and attuned to local needs.

The firm’s attorneys are well-versed in Texas personal injury law and are prepared to handle cases involving a wide array of circumstances. For example, in urban areas like Houston and Dallas, where traffic congestion contributes to frequent car accidents, Texas Lawyers Group has attorneys experienced in navigating complex motor vehicle claims. In industrial hubs like Midland and Odessa, where workplace injuries are common, the firm offers specialized expertise in employer liability cases. This localized approach allows Texas Lawyers Group to provide personalized representation that reflects the specific challenges faced by clients in different regions.

Texas Lawyers Group prides itself on its client-centered philosophy, which emphasizes compassion, communication, and results. The firm understands that suffering a personal injury can be a life-altering experience, often accompanied by physical pain, emotional distress, and financial hardship. To support clients during these difficult times, Texas Lawyers Group offers free initial consultations, allowing individuals to discuss their cases with an experienced attorney at no cost. The firm also operates on a contingency fee basis, meaning clients pay no legal fees unless the firm successfully recovers compensation on their behalf.

“Our clients are at the heart of everything we do,” added Jeff Howell, Esq. “We strive to make the legal process as seamless as possible, providing clear communication and dedicated advocacy to help our clients rebuild their lives after an injury.”

The firm’s commitment to client care extends beyond the courtroom. Texas Lawyers Group provides regular case updates, responds promptly to client inquiries, and ensures that every client understands their legal options. By fostering open communication and trust, the firm builds strong relationships with clients, empowering them to make informed decisions about their cases.

Texas Lawyers Group’s expanded personal injury practice covers a broad spectrum of case types, ensuring that no matter the nature of the injury, clients can find the representation they need. The firm handles cases involving motor vehicle accidents, including car, truck, 18-wheeler, motorcycle, and pedestrian accidents caused by negligent drivers or hazardous road conditions; workplace injuries, such as construction accidents, oilfield injuries, and other incidents resulting from unsafe working conditions or employer negligence; premises liability, including slip-and-fall accidents, inadequate security, and other injuries caused by unsafe property conditions; and wrongful death, supporting families who have lost loved ones due to the negligence or wrongful actions of others.

Each case is approached with meticulous attention to detail, thorough investigation, and a commitment to achieving the best possible outcome. Texas Lawyers Group works with medical experts, accident reconstruction specialists, and other professionals to build strong cases that stand up to scrutiny in negotiations and court proceedings.

Texas Lawyers Group’s expansion reflects its longstanding dedication to serving the people of Texas. Founded on the principle of equal access to justice, the firm has built a reputation for excellence in legal representation and client care.

With its expanded personal injury practice, Texas Lawyers Group is poised to become a leading resource for injury victims across Texas. The firm’s attorneys are prepared to take on complex cases, advocate fiercely for their clients, and deliver results that make a meaningful difference in people’s lives. By combining statewide coverage with a client-focused approach, Texas Lawyers Group is redefining what it means to provide accessible, effective legal representation in the personal injury field.

Texas Lawyers Group is a premier legal services provider dedicated to representing injury victims across Texas. With a team of experienced attorneys and a commitment to client satisfaction, the firm handles a wide range of personal injury cases, from motor vehicle accidents and wrongful death claims. Texas Lawyers Group operates with a mission to deliver justice and fair compensation for clients while fostering strong community ties through education and outreach. Headquartered in Dallas, the firm serves clients in every major city and community throughout the state.

Texas Vehicle Accidents: Your Guide to Legal Rights and Safety Call (888) 997-2148 for Your FREE Consultation – No Fees Unless We Win Vehicle accidents in Texas are a significant concern, with the state’s vast road network and high traffic volumes contributing to thousands of crashes annually. From bustling Houston highways to rural roads in West Texas, these incidents can lead to severe injuries, financial burdens, and emotional distress. This article provides a comprehensive guide to understanding Texas vehicle accidents, their causes, legal implications, and steps to take after a crash. Our goal is to empower you with clear, actionable information to navigate your rights and ensure safety, whether you’re a driver, passenger, or pedestrian. Understanding Vehicle Accidents in Texas Vehicle accidents encompass collisions involving cars, trucks, motorcycles, bicycles, or pedestrians, often resulting from negligence, road conditions, or mechanical failures. In Texas, these incidents are governed by personal injury law, including negligence and comparative fault principles. The Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT) reported 552,169 crashes in 2023, resulting in 3,855 fatalities and 18,827 serious injuries. Texas ranks among the top states for traffic deaths, highlighting the urgency of understanding legal recourse and safety measures. Common Causes of Vehicle Accidents Identifying the causes of vehicle accidents is crucial for determining liability and preventing future incidents. Common causes in Texas include: - Distracted Driving: Texting, phone use, or other distractions caused 17% of Texas crashes in 2023, leading to 2,026 serious injuries. - Speeding: Exceeding speed limits or driving too fast for conditions contributed to 25% of fatal crashes. - Driving Under the Influence (DUI): Alcohol or drugs were factors in 1,089 fatal crashes in 2023. - Failure to Yield: Ignoring traffic signals or right-of-way rules led to 15% of collisions. - Road Conditions: Poorly maintained roads, weather, or construction zones increase risks, especially in rural areas. Types of Injuries in Vehicle Accidents Vehicle accidents can result in a range of injuries, from minor to life-altering. Common injuries include: - Whiplash and Neck Injuries: Caused by sudden jolts, common in rear-end collisions. - Traumatic Brain Injuries (TBIs): Resulting from head impacts, leading to cognitive or physical impairments. - Broken Bones: Fractures from collisions or ejections. - Spinal Cord Injuries: Potentially causing paralysis, often from high-impact crashes. - Fatalities: Texas reported a fatality every 2 hours and 16 minutes on its roads in 2023. Legal Framework for Vehicle Accidents in Texas Texas law provides multiple avenues for seeking compensation after a vehicle accident, primarily through personal injury claims based on negligence. Understanding these legal principles is essential for building a strong case. Negligence and Liability Negligence occurs when a driver fails to exercise reasonable care, causing harm. To prove negligence, you must show: - The driver had a duty to operate the vehicle safely. - They breached that duty (e.g., by speeding or texting). - The breach directly caused the accident. - You suffered damages (e.g., medical bills, pain). Liability may extend to drivers, employers (in commercial vehicle cases), or manufacturers (for defective parts). Texas’s Modified Comparative Fault Rule Texas follows a modified comparative fault rule, meaning you can recover damages if you’re less than 51% at fault, but your compensation is reduced by your fault percentage. For example, if you’re 20% at fault and damages total $100,000, you’d receive $80,000. If you’re 51% or more at fault, you recover nothing. No-Fault vs. At-Fault System Texas is an at-fault state, meaning the responsible party’s insurance covers damages. Drivers must carry minimum liability insurance: - $30,000 per person for bodily injury - $60,000 per accident for bodily injury - $25,000 for property damage Personal Injury Protection (PIP) is optional but covers medical expenses regardless of fault. Dram Shop Laws Under Texas’s Dram Shop Act, establishments serving alcohol to visibly intoxicated individuals may be liable for accidents caused by those individuals. This applies to bars, restaurants, or event venues, providing an additional avenue for compensation in DUI-related crashes. Case Studies of Notable Texas Vehicle Accidents To illustrate the impact of vehicle accidents, here are two significant Texas cases that highlight causes and legal considerations. Case Study 1: Houston Multi-Vehicle Pileup (2021) In February 2021, icy conditions on a Houston freeway led to a 130-vehicle pileup, killing six people and injuring dozens. The crash was attributed to poor road maintenance and drivers failing to adjust for weather. Victims pursued claims against government entities for inadequate road treatment and negligent drivers, emphasizing the role of premises liability and comparative fault in complex accidents. Case Study 2: San Antonio DUI Crash (2022) A drunk driver in San Antonio struck a family’s vehicle, causing severe injuries to a child and parent. The driver’s blood alcohol level was twice the legal limit. The family filed a personal injury claim against the driver and a Dram Shop claim against the bar that overserved them, showcasing the importance of exploring multiple liability avenues. Steps to Take After a Vehicle Accident in Texas Taking immediate action after a vehicle accident can protect your health and legal rights. Follow these steps: - Ensure Safety: Move to a safe location if possible and check for injuries. Call 911 if anyone is hurt. - Exchange Information: Collect names, contact details, insurance information, and license plate numbers from all parties involved. - Document the Scene: Take photos of vehicles, injuries, road conditions, and traffic signs. Note the time, weather, and location. - File a Police Report: Report the accident to law enforcement, especially if injuries or significant damage occur. Obtain a copy of the report. - Seek Medical Attention: Visit a doctor promptly, even for minor symptoms, to document injuries. - Notify Your Insurer: Report the accident but avoid detailed statements until consulting an attorney. - Contact a Personal Injury Attorney: A lawyer can evaluate your case, negotiate with insurers, and pursue compensation. Damages Available in Texas Vehicle Accident Claims Victims may seek compensation, known as damages, for losses incurred. These include: - Economic Damages: - Medical expenses (hospital bills, surgeries, therapy) - Lost wages and future earning capacity - Property damage (vehicle repairs or replacement) - - Non-Economic Damages: - Pain and suffering - Emotional distress - Loss of enjoyment of life - - Punitive Damages (rare): Awarded for egregious behavior, like drunk driving, to punish and deter. - Wrongful Death Damages: For families of deceased victims, covering funeral costs, loss of support, and emotional loss. Texas Statute of Limitations for Vehicle Accidents In Texas, the statute of limitations for personal injury claims, including vehicle accidents, is two years from the date of the crash. Wrongful death claims also have a two-year limit, typically starting from the date of death. Exceptions may apply for minors or delayed injury discovery, but acting promptly preserves evidence and strengthens your claim. Safety Tips for Driving in Texas While accidents are often caused by others’ negligence, drivers can take steps to reduce risks: - Avoid Distractions: Keep phones out of reach and focus on the road. - Obey Speed Limits: Adjust speed for traffic, weather, or construction zones. - Never Drive Impaired: Avoid alcohol, drugs, or medications that impair driving. - Maintain Your Vehicle: Regularly check tires, brakes, and lights to prevent mechanical failures. - Use Seat Belts: Ensure all passengers are buckled up, reducing injury risks by 50%. FAQs About Texas Vehicle Accidents 1. What should I do immediately after a vehicle accident in Texas? Ensure safety, call 911 if needed, and exchange information with other parties. Document the scene with photos and file a police report. Seek medical attention promptly, notify your insurer, and consult a personal injury attorney before discussing the accident with insurance adjusters to protect your legal rights. 2. Who can be held liable for a vehicle accident in Texas? Liable parties may include negligent drivers, employers (for commercial vehicles), vehicle manufacturers (for defective parts), or establishments serving alcohol to drunk drivers (under Dram Shop laws). An attorney can investigate to identify all responsible parties and pursue compensation from their insurance or assets. 3. How does Texas’s comparative fault rule affect my claim? Texas’s modified comparative fault rule reduces your compensation by your percentage of fault if you’re less than 51% responsible. For example, if you’re 30% at fault and damages are $50,000, you’d receive $35,000. If you’re 51% or more at fault, you recover nothing. 4. How long do I have to file a vehicle accident claim in Texas? The statute of limitations for personal injury claims is two years from the accident date. Wrongful death claims also have a two-year limit from the date of death. Exceptions may apply for minors or delayed injuries, but acting quickly preserves evidence and strengthens your case. 5. What types of compensation can I seek after a vehicle accident? You may seek economic damages (medical bills, lost wages, property damage) and non-economic damages (pain, emotional distress). Punitive damages may apply for egregious acts like DUI. Wrongful death claims cover funeral costs and loss of support. An attorney can assess your claim’s value. 6. Can I file a claim if the other driver was uninsured? Yes, if you have uninsured/underinsured motorist (UM/UIM) coverage, you can file a claim with your insurer to cover damages. Alternatively, you may pursue a personal injury lawsuit against the uninsured driver, though collecting compensation can be challenging if they lack assets. 7. What are common causes of vehicle accidents in Texas? Distracted driving (17% of crashes), speeding (25% of fatal crashes), DUI (1,089 fatal crashes in 2023), failure to yield, and poor road conditions are leading causes. Identifying these factors helps establish liability and supports your claim for compensation. 8. How can a personal injury attorney help with my vehicle accident case? An attorney investigates the crash, gathers evidence (e.g., police reports, witness statements), and negotiates with insurers. They navigate Texas’s comparative fault and insurance laws to maximize compensation. Most work on a contingency basis, meaning no upfront fees. 9. What are the risks of not seeking medical attention after an accident? Failing to seek medical care can worsen injuries and weaken your claim. Insurers may argue your injuries are not serious or unrelated to the crash. Prompt medical documentation links injuries to the accident, strengthening your case for compensation. 10. How can I stay safe on Texas roads? Avoid distractions, obey speed limits, and never drive impaired. Maintain your vehicle and wear seat belts. Be cautious in construction zones or adverse weather. While you can’t control others, these steps reduce risks and protect you and your passengers. Why Consult a Texas Vehicle Accident Attorney? Vehicle accidents can result in overwhelming medical bills, lost income, and emotional trauma. An experienced personal injury attorney can: - Investigate Thoroughly: Analyze police reports, witness statements, and crash data to build a strong case. - Negotiate Effectively: Deal with insurance companies to secure fair compensation. - Navigate Complex Laws: Handle Texas’s comparative fault and insurance regulations to maximize recovery. - Advocate in Court: Represent you if a settlement isn’t reached, ensuring your rights are protected. Conclusion Texas vehicle accidents pose significant risks, with high rates of injuries and fatalities on the state’s roads. Understanding the causes, legal options, and safety measures is essential for protecting your rights and securing fair compensation. Whether dealing with medical expenses, lost wages, or emotional distress, acting quickly and consulting a personal injury attorney can make a difference. If you’ve been injured in a vehicle accident, contact a Texas lawyer today to explore your options and ensure justice is served. Contact Texas Personal Injury Lawyers today at (888) 997-2148 for your free consultation. Our experienced vehicle accident attorneys are ready to fight for the maximum compensation you deserve. Remember, we don’t collect any fees unless we win your case. Additional Resources For more information on vehicle accident safety, laws, and legal rights in Texas, explore these resources: - Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT): Provides crash statistics, safety tips, and road condition reports. https://www.txdot.gov/safety - Texas Department of Insurance – Auto Insurance: Details on insurance requirements and consumer rights. https://www.tdi.texas.gov/consumer/auto-insurance.html - National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA): Federal safety standards and crash data. https://www.nhtsa.gov/road-safety
